fields.description: I'd be very helpful if there were a way to filter next-gen projects using a function for JQL.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have an efficient way to filter next-gen projects

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to have the information about the total of sub-tasks under a given Epic.
Show the number of subtask totals in the epic when the story is attached to the epic and the subtask is attached to the story.
fields.summary: Show the number of subtask totals in the epic when the story is attached to the epic and the subtask is attached to the story.

fields.description:
Jira new issue view does not sum up Estimations from Sub-tasks.
 !image-2019-05-30-16-01-51-975.png|thumbnail! 
It works fine at the Jira Old view
 !image-2019-05-30-16-01-16-899.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Jira new issue view does not sum up Estimations from Sub-tasks

fields.description:
I don't get why we can't just have FULL Jira in Next-Gen... you take away features for no apparent reason. And it takes FOREVER for things to change.

 

Can't run parallel sprints, can't change working days from 5 to 7 (or whatever), etc... *why?!*
fields.summary: Please stop gimping Jira Next-Gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you create a next-gen project re-using the project key of a deleted classic project which used to use a simplified workflow and the workflow is still present in Jira, when you create a classic board to display the issues of this new next-gen project, it's not possible to add columns to the board due to the error:

{code}Illegal Entity Scope for Entity class (WORKFLOW). Expected entity scope 'GLOBAL' but has scope 'PROJECT'{code}


h3. Environment

Jira Software cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a classic Scrum project. Make sure it's using a simplified workflow
# Delete this Scrum project
# Create a new next-gen project using the same key of the deleted project
# Create a filter to return all the issues from the new next-gen project
# Create a new classic Scrum board based on the filter created in the previous step
# Access the board's settings and in the "Columns" session, add a new column to the board

h3. Expected Results

The column is created

h3. Actual Results

The error {{Illegal Entity Scope for Entity class (WORKFLOW). Expected entity scope 'GLOBAL' but has scope 'PROJECT'}} is displayed

 !Screen Shot 2019-05-30 at 12.26.56 PM.png|thumbnail! 

{noformat}
com.atlassian.jira.scope.IllegalScopedEntityArgumentException: Illegal Entity Scope for Entity class (WORKFLOW). Expected entity scope 'GLOBAL' but has scope 'PROJECT'
	at com.atlassian.jira.scope.EntityScopeUtil.assertGlobalScope(EntityScopeUtil.java:138)
	at com.atlassian.jira.scope.EntityScopeUtil.assertGlobalScope(EntityScopeUtil.java:125)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.assertWorkflowIsGlobalScoped(OSWorkflowManager.java:1374)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.getWorkflowClone(OSWorkflowManager.java:389)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.util.ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.java:26)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy166.getWorkflowClone(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:333)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:56)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:60)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:133)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:121)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor$1.run(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:61)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.util.internal.PrivilegedUtils.executeWithCustomTCCL(PrivilegedUtils.java:130)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invokePrivileged(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:58)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invoke(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:50)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.LocalBundleContextAdvice.invoke(LocalBundleContextAdvice.java:57)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:133)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:121)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:213)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy4229.getWorkflowClone(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.workflow.SimplifiedWorkflowServiceImpl.getMutableWorkflow(SimplifiedWorkflowServiceImpl.java:959)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.workflow.SimplifiedWorkflowServiceImpl.addStatusToGreenHopperSimplifiedWorkflow(SimplifiedWorkflowServiceImpl.java:313)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.workflow.WorkflowHelper.addStatusToGreenHopperSimplifiedWorkflow(WorkflowHelper.java:212)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewEditHelper.addColumnAndStatus(RapidViewEditHelper.java:693)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewEditResource.lambda$addNewColumn$0(RapidViewEditResource.java:101)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.util.RestCall.response(RestCall.java:40)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.AbstractResource.createResponse(AbstractResource.java:103)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.AbstractResource.response(AbstractResource.java:85)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewEditResource.addNewColumn(RapidViewEditResource.java:91)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngineValve.invoke(StandardEngineValve.java:74)
	at org.apache.catalina.valves.ErrorReportValve.invoke(ErrorReportValve.java:92)
	at org.apache.catalina.valves.RemoteIpValve.invoke(RemoteIpValve.java:679)
	at org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteAdapter.service(CoyoteAdapter.java:343)
	at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.service(Http11Processor.java:408)
	at org.apache.coyote.AbstractProcessorLight.process(AbstractProcessorLight.java:66)
	at org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol$ConnectionHandler.process(AbstractProtocol.java:834)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$SocketProcessor.doRun(NioEndpoint.java:1417)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.SocketProcessorBase.run(SocketProcessorBase.java:49)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{noformat}



h3. Notes


h3. Workaround

Delete the inactive workflow scheme and workflow related to the deleted project
fields.summary: Creating next-gen projects using the key used in inactive workflows causes problems to add columns to boards

fields.description:
For now, it is only possible to use the search box on Active Sprint screen to search for Assignees on issues. 
It would be nice if customers have also the option to use the search box to find issues by Reporters.

For now, the option is to create some Quickfilters, but this is not ideal when you have a large number of different reporters as possibility.
fields.summary: Ability to search for issues on active sprint based on Reporter

fields.description:
When using multiple Jira boards within tabs, its difficult to see which board is which, and often I click through them all to find the board I'm looking for. As there is already a feature to have a custom thumbnail, could we have a custom favicon for each board? this would save me hours and hours of my life 

 

Thank you
fields.summary: Custom favicon for jira tabs

fields.description:
As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to manually link to pull requests or commits for the development panel on a given issue.

This would allow users to retroactively relate older or malformed commits and pull requests to an issue without having to rebase or force-push changes to the codebase. Minor, and easily avoidable by enforcing the format of the commit message and pull request title.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to manually link to pull requests or commits for the development panel on a given issue

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to be able to select when moving an issue to a Next-Gen project if it will be displayed at the board or at the backlog.

Currently, any moved issue will be automatically placed at the backlog, even that the status is not the first status of the workflow.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to select when moving an issue to a Next-Gen project if it will be displayed at the board or at the backlog

fields.description:
Kanban Board not showing user profile id and photo.

[https://richardshapiro.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=26&projectKey=DEV&view=detail&selectedIssue=QA-244]
fields.summary: Failed to Retrieve User 5b3e33e0536f9e2e2f6f6c48

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As mentioned in [Roadmap|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/roadmap-957979308.html], when creating an Epic in the Roadmap view, a *Start date* is automatically set to a value based on where the timeline is positioned.

 !Next_gen_-_Roadmap_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Proposed solution

Introduce the option to disable this feature for teams that do not wish to define a start date at the creation of the Epic.

h3. Workaround

To avoid this, you can create the Epic using the standard Issue creator *+* which does not set a *Start date*.
fields.summary: Make start date automatic assignment optional for Roadmaps in Next-gen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some of options in sprint duration field are not visible when JIRA language is selected as Russian.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a sprint and add an issue to the sprint
# In your _Personal settings_ select *Russian* language
# In Backlog click on *Start sprint* for the sprint created in step #1
# Click on *Duration* drop-down list

h3. Expected Results
Options appears as in screenshot below:
 !Sprint duration - English.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Options for "2 weeks", "3 weeks" and "4 weeks" are invisible:
 !Sprint duration - Russian.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
As a workaround please set JIRA language in your personal settings to English.
fields.summary: Sprint duration options (drop-down list) are not visible in Russian language

fields.description:
Hi JIRA Admin,

Could you help me to simplify the search issue filter base by issue key because existing we can't  search issue filter by issue key.
 

Best Regards,
Rizanuary Fauzi
Telkomsel Delivery & Managed Operation | +6282110200971
!http://mail.sigma.co.id/home/rizanuary.fauzi@sigma.co.id/Briefcase/logo tsigma.png!
PT. Sigma Cipta Caraka
http://www.telkomsigma.co.id/
fields.summary: simplify the search issue filter base by issue key

fields.description:
When talking about sprints in the backlog-view it would help a lot to see how many hours are left for each of the tickets. At the moment only the original estimate is shown. 
See here for an image https://ibb.co/5hM7dJX
fields.summary: Backlog-View: Show Estimates in the form <remaining>/<original>

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you upload a CSV, and match one of the columns to the *Flagged* field in Jira, it is possible to create new values for that field, but you will not be able to remove any since the field is locked.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Prepare a CSV file such as this one:  [^Flagged values import test.csv]; 
* Import via *External System Import* -> *CSV*;
* During the import, match the CSV column with the *Flagged* field:
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-27 at 09.03.05.png|thumbnail! 

The field original's state before the import:
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-27 at 09.00.13.png|thumbnail! 

The field's state after the import:
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-27 at 09.04.07.png|thumbnail! 

Notice that that's a locked field, and it is not possible to edit it configuration:
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-27 at 09.04.45.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

It should not be possible to create new values to that field if you cannot remove them.


h3. Actual Results

New values are created in the field, but it is not possible to remove them.


h3. Workaround

Contact Atlassian Support to have the new values removed from the field.
fields.summary: It is possible to create values to a locked field (Flagged) via CSV import

fields.description:
Currently there is a limitation of 5 Avatars on the Jira Cloud next-gen board.

When a team is larger than this, you must select from a drop down for the remaining team members, despite sufficient screen realestate to show more.

Could you please expand this to as many as the screen will allow? This would be useful for touch-screens where Jira Cloud is used.
fields.summary: Show more than 5 Avatars on Next-Gen Agile Board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The *Apply* button of _Refine Report_ of the Cumulative Flow Diagram is not visible when there are many Columns/Swimlanes/Quick Filters.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Board
# Configure many Columns/Swimlanes/Quick Filters
# Access the Cumulative Flow Diagram and try to refine the report

h3. Expected Results
# Users are able to refine and click on the *Apply* button as normal

h3. Actual Results
The *Apply* button is hidden because it is at the bottom of the screen

 !2013-11-14 19 58 38.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Happens in all browsers

h3. Workaround

Zoom out in the browser view makes the "Apply" button visible
fields.summary: Huge amount of quick filters makes apply button disappear in report view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As a vendor of BigPicture we have performance issues with Jira Software Cloud REST API.
We use endpoint {{/rest/agile/1.0/board}} for getting all available boards. What we need is the ID of filter the board is based on. This information is stored in the board configuration. Consequently, we are getting multiple boards in a few requests and then we get board configuration with single requests for board. Board configuration API does not scale so good as getting boards.

When our application makes multiple requests it's eventually throttled.

We would like to request bulk board configuration REST API endpoint.
fields.summary: Bulk board configuration fetch REST endpoint

fields.description:
*Issue*

Currently when viewing an active sprint with various issues in each column, +it is impossible to tell at a glance how many are in each+. I see no easy way to find this without going to Advanced Search in issues and filters which is overcomplicated.

*Suggestion*

Add a settings toggle that allows for a total issue count to be displayed at the top of each column - having 0's on empty columns could be greyed out or removed entirely to avoid distraction.

Perhaps you could even set custom thresholds for "warning" colours. If >10 issues in a column, change the total count number to red. Immediately at a glance, you would then see how the number of issues in each and which are getting clogged up etc.

*Example*

!image-2019-05-24-09-20-57-349.png!

https://i.imgur.com/vVVIraR.png
fields.summary: Total issue count at the top of a sprint column

fields.description: There is a field in the bulk editor for assigning an epic but the drop down does not show any values, even though i have a number of epics i woudl like to assign.
fields.summary: Cannot assign Epic on Bulk Edit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the burnup report, date is incorrect by one day. The today's line is pointing at yesterday's date:

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a next-gen JIRA Software project, and turn on the estimation feature to use story points.
 # Create a sprint and assign an issue to the sprint
 # Start the sprint with a date in the past to see the problem better.
 # Go to burnup report

h3. Expected Results

The today's date is showing correctly
h3. Actual Results

Date is incorrect by one date. (The today's line)
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Today's line in the burnup report is pointing at the yesterday's date instead of the today's date

fields.description:
As a project manager, I want Jira to prompt my team to input worklog time when they transition an issue to certain states so that my team does a better job time tracking and I can keep my project on budget.
h2. Acceptance Criteria
 * I can make a rule that prompts the user for standard Jira worklog input (time/duration work log)
 * The rule can be applied to 0 or All state changes
 ** e.g. A dev moves an issue from in-progress to Awaiting-QA
 ** e.g. A QA moves the same issue from In-Test to Verified
fields.summary: Next-gen - Add rule type to prompt for worklog input on state transition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User logged in is not showing up as the first in the assignees quick filter

h3. Environment

Jira Software cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a classic project
# Add many issues to the project
# Assign those issues to yourself and other users
# Check the assignees' quick filter

h3. Expected Results

User logged in shows up as the first in the assignees' quick filter

h3. Actual Results

User logged in is not showing up as the first in the assignees quick filter

 !Screen Shot 2019-05-23 at 3.15.00 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround
No workaround available for now
fields.summary: User logged in is not showing up as the first in the assignees' quick filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary
We are heavily using {{/search}} endpoint, to fetch issues via JQL. We are fetching up to 10k issues. Some of the functionalities our product provides are based on Jira Agile extension. In order to fetch Jira Agile context of an issue we use endpoint:
https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-rest-agile-1-0-issue-issueIdOrKey-get

The problem is, that this endpoint does not scale as well as JQL search endpoint. This results in our app performing multiple requests on Jira Cloud instance that results in Jira instance performance degradation and eventually our app being throttled.

As a performance improvement, we would like to request bulk issue getting REST API endpoint.
fields.summary: Bulk issue fetch

fields.description:
Users that enjoy the visual appearance of task management (designers) would like to have the ability to assign a color to a label. 

By assigning a color to a label it would allow the user to visually pick out the tasks quickly that have that label.
fields.summary: Next-gen - Assign a color to a label

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Next-gen boards are showing the errors below:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Next-gen board

h3. Expected Results
No error is listed.

h3. Actual Results
Boards are loading but with errors. 

h3. Notes
This is not impacting all sites.

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Error Flag "Board failed to load" showing due to dev-status service

fields.description:
Currently, it's not possible to a non-registered user to watch an issue. However, in many companies, not all the employees are registered as Jira user but might need to get informed when an issue is in development or have been resolved.

It would be perfect if Atlassian allow a Jira user to add an e-mail in the watch options of an issue.
fields.summary: Send issue updates to a given e-mail

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When completing a sprint shared between multiple projects, only incomplete issues that are part of the board where you complete the sprint are moving to the next sprint.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 3 scrum projects and issues on each of them.
 # Create a sprint on project 1 and add the issues (from all projects) on the same sprint.
 # Start sprint 1.
 # Create a new sprint on project 1.
 # Finish sprint 1 on project 1 and ask to move the issues to sprint 2.
 # *Issues from project 1 were moved to sprint 2.*
 # *Issues from project 2 and 3 were moved back to the backlog, they were removed from sprint 1 and not added into the sprint 2.*

h3. Expected Results

All incomplete issues should move to the next sprint.
h3. Actual Results

Only incomplete issues that are part of the board filter are moving to the next sprint.
h3. Workaround

Create a board that includes all issues on this sprint or bulk edit the other incompleted issues, associating them to the next sprint.

h3. Additional notes

No documentation was found on https://confluence.atlassian.com/ classifying if it is as expected behavior.
If it is expected behavior, please update the public documentation [Completing a sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/completing-a-sprint-764478128.html] and change this bug as an improvement request.
fields.summary: When you complete a sprint that is shared between multiple projects, not all incomplete issues are moving to the next sprint.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we have multiple branches in one issue connected to the same repository.
 Upon clicking "Branches" from development panel > on the branch to Create pull request > click create pull requests

The branch to merge from will choose the first branch that is created as a default.
 We will still need to choose the correct branch created from issue from the dropdown.

We should expect that the branch shown on the source branch to be merged is the branch that we have click from Jira.
 !From Jira.png|thumbnail! 

 !After clicking on pull create pull request defaults as different selection.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two branches from Jira
 # Click on branches again
 # Click on the create pull request on second branch.

h3. Expected Results

The source branch should be the selected branch that was chosen from Jira
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating branch and creating on pull request from development panel will choose the branch option as a default branch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When granting anonymous access to a Jira Software Project, anonymous users won't have access to any of the Boards associated with the Project.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
(i) [Allowing Anonymous Access To Your Project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/allowing-anonymous-access-to-your-project-779172888.html]]
{panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Grant the *Browse Projects* permission to group *Anyone*
 # In the Board associated with the Project, make the filter public by sharing to *Public*

h3. Expected Results

Anyone with the URL link to the Board and/or Project can open the link and view the Board and its content.

h3. Actual Results

Board is restricted and login is required.

h3. Notes

Anonymous users can still view the Issues themselves and the filter being used by the Board, they just can see the Board itself.

h3. Workaround

No workaround to view the Board anonymously. Maybe use a filter?
fields.summary: Cannot grant anonymous access to Software Boards

fields.description:
If you put link to the telegram messenger to the private project (example: [https://champion.atlassian.net/browse/CH-123)] Telegram will make a request with

User-Agent: TelegramBot (like TwitterBot)

to get preview. But there's nothing to preview, because project is private.

Can you make so that Telegram understands that there's nothing to preview (probably just answer with empty body).

 

(sorry, I failed to choose correct Component)
fields.summary: Ignore requests from User-Agent: TelegramBot (like TwitterBot) for private projects

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to have the option to customize the system swimlanes.

Use case:
I have a field where is stored the old issues assignee value.

I would like to customize the Assignee swimlanes to show all issues where assignee = X or oldassignee = X.

The swimlanes based on queries would not work since you cannot create a condition to list all assignees.
fields.summary: Customisable system swimlanes.

fields.description:
Currently, the classic Kanban board displays "Kanban board" instead of the board's name:

 !Screen Shot 2019-05-20 at 7.22.17 PM.png|thumbnail! 

As a Jira Software user, I want the board's name displayed as the board's title instead of "Kanban board".
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want the board's name displayed as the board's title instead of "Kanban board"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As a Jira user, when viewing a project backlog I plan out a quarter's worth of sprints at a time. The trouble I run into is by default it seems that I get a large backlog >300 (related to the same sprint or different ones) making scrolling fairly difficult and drag and drop functionality also becomes tricky.

h3. Suggested Solution
* If I have a way to collapse part of the backlog it would be great.

For example: 

*  if I go through and collapse each sprint, it becomes much easier.
 

h3. Why this is important
 
* Ease a lot of the pain to drag and drop in a long backlog. 
 
h3. Workaround 

* A workaround for now is the *"Move to - Bottom of column"* feature.
fields.summary: Provide an easier way to drag/drop issues in a long backlog

fields.description:
Our team would love the feature of being able to switch the sprint board view with an easy toggle between "group by: epic" and "show all tasks in one lane". 
 At the moment it's only possible for the admin to change the view of the entire board permanently, but every team member would like to have their personalized swimlanes for the sprint board and easily toggle between the views.
fields.summary: Switch between swimlanes "group by" in Sprint board

fields.description:
When using the old view and flagging an issue, it has an option to add a comment before adding the flag.
It would be good if we also have this option on the new issue view to make sure users will add the reason why they are flagging the issue.
fields.summary: Ability to add a comment when flagging an issue

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to have the ability to export a customer friendly roadmap on Next-Gen projects such that customers are abstracted from task size, start date and that the end date is only shown with Quarter granularity.

The current roadmap is perfect for an internal roadmap, but provides too much data for customers.

Proposal:

 
||Available||Q2||Q3||Q4||Q1 2020||
|Feature 1
Feature 2
 
|Feature 3
Feature 4
 
|Feature 5
Feature 6
Feature 7|Feature 8
Feature 9
 
|Feature 10
Feature 11
Feature 12|

The available column would show if the Status filter includes "Done" features.
fields.summary: Export Customer Roadmap

fields.description:
Assignee filter display users that don't have issue returned by the filter at the Active Sprint board.
The Assignee filter at the Active Sprint should pick only the assignees of the issues that are returned by the filter and not the assignees that have issues assigned to a sprint, even that the issue is not being returned by the board filter.

h3. Reproducing
# Create a couple of issues
# Create a sprint
# Assign the issues to different users
# Add issues to the Sprint
# Change the board filter to return the issues by the assignee (do not include all the assignees)
# Start the sprint

At the backlog, only the users that have the issues returned by the filter will be displayed at the Assignee Filter. At the Active Sprint, it shows all the users that have an issue inside that sprint, even that the issue is not returned by the filter.
fields.summary: Assignee filter display users that don't have issue returned by the filter at the Active Sprint board

fields.description: We would like a phone number custom field option, that formats phone numbers based on country
fields.summary: Phone Number Custom Field

fields.description:
Filters reduce or limit the information you see.
I'd like to use a multi-level swimlane on my software boards in order to display everything on the board respecting the multi-level sort order defined by multi-swimlanes.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to use a multi-level swimlane on my software boards

fields.description:
In Jira Software projects (both classic and next-gen), it's possible to link Bitbucket repositories using the "Add item" feature.

If a user doesn't have the right permissions to integrate a Bitbucket account and link a repository, a generic error message is displayed, telling the user they need to access Bitbucket to fix it.

This message can be misleading and it would be better if this message includes the user must be an administrator to integrate a Bitbucket account and link a repository to the project.
fields.summary: Permission message improvement in the repository linking feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When specifying a project in a complex filter the inline creation behaves differently. For example, using component = X will display the expected pop-up dialog with the correct message. Using project = Y OR component = X, will display an error message in the pop-up dialog.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Software project and a board;
 # Create a component (this will be used in the OR clause);
 # Update the filter of your board to project = X OR component = Y;
 # Use the in-line issue creation button in the Backlog.

h3. Expected Results

The user should automatically receive the pop-up full dialog to select the project as below:
 !Screen Recording 2019-05-16 at 02.51 PM.gif! 

h3. Actual Results

The user is able to type some information in the inline creation, but the full dialog pop-ups with an error:
 !Screen Recording 2019-05-16 at 02.55 PM.gif! 
h3. Workaround

By clicking in create the issue is still created.
fields.summary: When specifying a project in a complex filter the inline creation behaves differently.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an issue is flagged you could see the value of *Flagged* field is updated to "Impediment" in the issue history. However, in software board the issue is not highlighted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
In Kanban/Scrum board, right click on an issue and select *Add flag*

h3. Expected Results
A flag label is added to the issue/card and the issue is highlighted:
 !Kanban board - Flagged issue.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
There's no flag label in the issue/card and the flagged issue appears the same as non-flagged issues.

h3. Workaround
This issue is caused when the *Flagged* field is set as "Hidden" in the field configuration being used by project. But the *Flagged* is a system field and is _Locked_, it can't be configured in field configuration through JIRA UI.
Please contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/] for assistance.
fields.summary: Flagging an issue does not highlight the issue in board

fields.description: As a Jira project administrator, I want to be able to map new issues to existing epics when using bulk import, so that I can save time and effort when working with a large number of issues at once.
fields.summary: Ability to assign new issues to existing epics in next gen project when using bulk import

fields.description:
[URL:  http://altumed.atlassain.net|http://altumed.atlassain.net/]

UserName: [Babar.bhutta@altumed.com|mailto:Babar.bhutta@altumed.com]

We cannot access the admin panel. we need to create a user and roles.

Can you please update us asap how can we access the Jira software administration.
fields.summary: How can we access the admin panel using Jira.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, users are able to choose how to open the issue detail view by clicking the three dot icon and selecting "Open issues in sidebar" or "Open issues in dialog", as described at https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/changes-to-issues-in-the-new-issue-view-966684842.html. 

However, this option is available only in the kanban/scrum boards.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be great if this option is available in the backlog too.
fields.summary: Ability to choose the issue details open type(sidebar/dialog) in the backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to change a *Next-gen* project icon after uploading a photo
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Go to a any next-gen project > Project settings > Details > Change icon > Upload a photo > *Save*
h3. Expected Results

The icon will change
h3. Actual Results

!Screen Shot 2019-05-15 at 17.12.44.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Refreshing and trying again should resolve the problem
fields.summary: Unable to change a Next-gen project icon after uploading a photo

fields.description: The first time login will failed especially when using saved password in the browser. It usually happen regardless if user using 3rd party login (eg. Google) A error screen would display and ask user to clear their cache.
fields.summary: Login issue: Firefox in Private Mode

fields.description:
When customers have issues with the Jira Mobile application they can sometimes receive generic messages which don't help understanding what is happening:

"Something's gone wrong. Try restarting the app and signing in again."


In one case, they weren't added to the correct groups, to give project access.

Suggestion:
Provide troubleshooting steps for users to contact Admin or "what went wrong"
fields.summary: Improving Jira Mobile error messages

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Jira Software, link a Bitbucket account
 # In Bitbucket side, create two PRs and include an issue key in each of the PR comments
# Return to Jira Software, navigate to the mentioned issue key and click "2 branches" in the development panel

h3. Expected Results
User is able to see the two branches

h3. Actual Results
The following error is shown:
{code}
You don't have access to view all related branches. Please contact your administrator.
{code}
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-15 at 11.48.50 am.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Clicking "N branches" in the dev panel returns "You don't have access to view all related branches. Please contact your administrator."

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* An inactive user shows up in the board if the board has one or more issues with a parent issue assigned to this user.

h3. Suggested Solution
* The board should show only users who are assignees of the issues on the board and not users who belong to a parent issue.

h3. Workaround
* Reassigning the parent issue to another user fixes it
fields.summary: An inactive user shouldn't show up on board if the user is not an assignee of any of the issues

fields.description:
Currently, releases show "X days left" counting all week and weekend days.
It would be great if we have an option to set working days for releases so we could see the correct left days.
fields.summary: Releases/Versions count all days instead of working days

fields.description:
*Suggestion Example*

https://mega.nz/#!SDpjCIxC!TS7A4CQlsvbk5C_42mrl1TUDIRNHYL9eIyp3VEX_AZQ
fields.summary: Allow edit the JQL in the default Swimlane.

fields.description:
*Suggestion Example*

https://mega.nz/#!6LpnyKYL!scQHTBrmbyNhD7EMamCu8JYqVdumhU1oAEt5Gtfjc80
fields.summary: Add sub swimlanes on Kanban Board.

fields.description:
When sub-task is created, it doesn't inherit the Epic link from the parent. This creates some issues, like:

* If a board is configured to use Epics swimlanes and you have visible on this board an Epic, and under this Epic a story and a sub-task under this story, if by some reason the story is not visible on the board (due to filter conditions or status mapping configuration), the sub-task is displayed under the "Issues without Epics" instead of being displayed under the Epic linked to its parent
* This also causes time reporting to create orphaned hours for sub-tasks which have no epic.

Defining sub-tasks to inherit their parents' Epic link would resolve both problems
fields.summary: Sub-tasks should inherit their parent's Epic Link

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently on the Jira mobile app for iOS devices, *Quick filters* are not available in the *Backlog* view of Software Boards.

h3. Proposed solution

Include the option to toggle *Quick filters* in the Backlog view as it is in the *Active sprint* view for more filtering efficiency.
fields.summary: Quick filters for Backlog view on iOS app

fields.description: I would like the ability to select a user, then see which projects they are assigned to
fields.summary: Ability to view which projects a user has access to

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to import issues via CSV into team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects, CSV importer failed to assign the issue as Epic

h3. Environment
* team-managed (formerly next-gen) project
* CSV Importer

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create EPIC issues on project A (team-managed (formerly next-gen))
# Export the EPIC issues into CSV
# Import the CSV file into another team-managed (formerly next-gen)n project

h3. Expected Results
* Issues are created as Epic

h3. Actual Results
Issues are created as Story/Task instead

h3. Workaround
# Import the Epic issues into company-managed (formerly classic) project
# Move the issues from company-managed (formerly classic) project to team-managed (formerly next-gen)
#* [Migrate between team-managed and company-managed projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-from-an-agility-project-to-a-classic-project-957974933.html]
fields.summary: Team-managed (formerly next-gen) - CSV Import - Failed to assign Epic as IssueType

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Remove issues from current sprint on Burnup chart report changes the issue's summary as 'Undefined'.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new sprint.
 # Create issues on this sprint.
 # Start the sprint.
 # Check the Burnup chart report.
 # Remove some issues from this sprint.
 # Check the Burnup chart report again.
 # The issues removed from this sprint will have the summary showing as 'Undefined'.

 !Screen Shot 2019-05-14 at 11.50.06.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Remove issues from current sprint on Burnup chart report changes the issue's summary to 'Undefined'.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Changing project Key doesn't update at the browser tab bar at the Next-Gen project

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Next-Gen project
# Have its Key changed
# The board will display the new project key
# The browser tab will keep old key

h3. Expected Results
The browser title tab bar should be updated with the new project key

h3. Actual Results
The browser tab will keep old key

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changing project Key at the Next-Gen project doesn't update at the browser tab bar

fields.description:
When a user edits the issue's status using the board's issue detail view, the board scrolls automatically to the issue's position when the issue detail view is closed.

As a Jira Software user, I want to disable this auto scroll behavior, since when there are many issues visible on the board (100+, for example) it's easy to get lost on the board's position
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to disable the auto scroll on the board when an issue's status is changed

fields.description:
Trying to delete an issue currently shows an alert that ends:  

"> If you're not sure, you can resolve or close this issue instead."

However, there is no way to "close" an issue on next-gen project – or at least, no two ways to finish an issue. In each project, an issue can only be resolved a single way, whatever the last column on the board is, is the resolution status.  

Therefore, this alert should read something like, "If you're not sure, you can resolve this issue instead." 

(This is a deliberate choice apparently, [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-questions/How-do-you-resolve-or-close-an-issue-in-a-next-gen-project/qaq-p/1050600] While I think that only one way to resolve an causes problems, especially with issue statistics, fixing the copy will prevent others from looking for how to "close" an issue from the delete alert text, when there is only a single alternative to deletion. This ticket is *only about the delete alert text* being not accurate about the 1 single alternative to deleting.)
fields.summary: Delete "you can resolve or close this issue instead" text not accurate

fields.description:
!image-2019-05-13-22-25-38-309.png|width=291,height=233!

My Jira language is set to Japanese. As you can see in the above snippet, the due date from the issue is displayed as "20 MAY" instead of "5月20日". Even using the ISO format (2019-05-20) would be preferable.
h3. Workaround

Added because I couldn't create the issue without this heading
fields.summary: Due dates on Kanban board are not localised

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When associating a sprint with a cloned issue in next-gen, the issue gets removed from the sprint after a refresh of the page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Clone an issue in a next-gen project
 # Add value to the sprint field for the issue
 # Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

The issue gets permanently added to the sprint.
h3. Actual Results

The sprint field clears after a refresh.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Not able to update the sprint field for cloned issues in next-gen project

fields.description:
As a Jira administrator, I would like to have a Sprint Report where I could see a global view of all existing projects and sprints in Jira.

This report should include filters for:
# Project.
# Assignee.
# Planned, Active and Completed sprints.

This report should show:
# The sprint start date, end date, completion date.
# The issue key, the issue status, the issue assignee.
fields.summary: Global Sprint Report.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
branches getting deleted as part of the normal PR flow they are still shown in the summary

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Sync the BitBucket with Jira
# Create a branch in BitBucket to a Jira issue
# Wait for it to sync in Jira
# Have the branch deleted
# The dev console will show that there are branches
# The dev panel will show a message that there are branches but you don't have permission to see it.

h3. Expected Results
Having a branch deleted should update the dev console and dev panel to not display ghosts (deleted) branches.

h3. Actual Results
The dev panel and console still shows the deleted but displays a message that the user doesn't have permission to see them

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround
fields.summary: branches getting deleted as part of the normal PR flow they are still shown in the summary

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Viewing branch details in Jira shows repository UUID instead of repository name.
This happens when looking at the details for a branch and that branch was in a PR.
The scenario when this is reproducible.

• Branch for a PR has been deleted


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Branch details in Jira shows repository UUID instead of repository name.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When using Jira Sprint Report, you may select which sprint the report should display. If you have sprints using long names, the dropdown menu will cut off the last characters of a sprint which is at or near its maximum length (30 characters).

Also, this menu does not include all sprints if you have several sprints created on the board (new and closed sprints)

 !Screen Shot 2019-05-09 at 4.04.04 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Increase the base width of the dropdown menu since it seems to be cutting it close.

h3. Why this is important

Best case, this issue occurring is an inconvenience and can cause confusion, and in general looks unpolished.

Worst case, this leads to the inability to identify the differences between two sprint names which are identical except for the last few characters.
 
h3. Workaround 

You can type in the field to search for specific sprints
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to see full sprint name on the Sprint Report dropdown when long

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira navigation menu shows Bitbucket account UUID rather than account name

h3. Environment

Jira Software cloud integrated with Bitbucket cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
# Integrate a Jira cloud site with and Bitbucket cloud account
# Check the Navigation menu

h3. Expected Results

The Jira navigation menu shows Bitbucket account name

h3. Actual Results

Jira navigation menu shows Bitbucket account UUID

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround

No workaround is available for now.
fields.summary: Jira navigation menu shows Bitbucket account UUID rather than account name
Predicted completion dates calculation on Version Report is not accurate

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The implementation of the feature to exclude "done" Epics when editing the Epic Links field causes confusion.

This could be described a few different ways. I've done my best to represent the nature of the problem and I'm sure the Jira Cloud folks will work out the right solution.

* If you type into the Epic Link field, the option to show Epics that are marked done is not available.
* When you Clone an Epic that was "marked as done", this status/value is applied to the new Epic.
* There is no way to mark an Epic "not done" for JSW purposes if you marked it done by mistake.

h3. Environment
* Production / hello.atlassian.net

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On an Epic in a JSW board, use the "Mark as done" feature.
!epic-mark-done.png|thumbnail!
# Clone this Epic. The result is the "new Epic".
# Go to an Issue that has the Epic Link field.
# Paste the key of the new Epic into the field.

h3. Expected Results 
* The "Show done epics" checkbox should be visible
* After checking the box, the new Epic should appear for linking.
* I should be able to mark an Epic "not done".

h3. Actual Results
* The UI says the issue cannot be found. Very confusing since the issue is visible elsewhere and the exact issue key was pasted.
!epic-not-found-by-key.png|thumbnail!
* If you paste in an issue key as your first action, there is no way to discover the "Show done epics" option. The only way to make it appear is to remove the text you entered.
!epic-click-show-done-first.png|thumbnail!
* The new Epic will not appear in any JSW board so there is no way to mark it "not done". This doesn't appear to be a custom field that can be added to the Edit view or changed via Bulk Edit.

h3. Workaround
* To associate an issue with a "marked done" epic, click the dropdown control *first* and check the "show done epics" box, *before* you search for the epic.
* Avoid using Clone with an Epic. From Issue Details there is no way to tell if it's been "marked as done" in a Scrum Board and your new Epic won't be visible in any other board.
fields.summary: Associating an issue with an Epic that was "marked done" causes confusion

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
An issue on Epic on a next-gen project gets cloned incorrectly, and therefore cannot be added to an active sprint from the backlog.

h3. Environment

 * Next-gen project
 * Sub-tasks available

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a next-gen project with the sub-tasks feature available
 # Create an issue (story/task/bug)
 # Clone that issue
 # Try to add the cloned issue to the active sprint
 # Refresh the page

[Video|https://cl.ly/d0f056a48fc7] demonstrating this behavior.

h3. Expected Results
The issue is added to the sprint.

h3. Actual Results
The issue is not added to the sprint.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
The customer needs to contact support so they can fix this inconsistency directly on the database.
fields.summary: Cloning an issue on an Epic on next-gen project results in an incorrectly cloned issue

fields.description:
I have an issue with the text pasting in Jira. For example there is an issue created in Jira and I want to paste text from an email or other document, some part of text is with different color in order to mark important places, but once I paste this text to Jira issue comment all text formating is gone (text color, text style and so on).

Another problem is that picture can not be pasted as well.
fields.summary: Text formating from other palce is not accepted

fields.description:
Creating a new Classic Scrum/Kanban projects in Jira does not add the Story points field in the proper screens. 

h3. Environment
All Cloud and mobile is affected too.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new project
 # Go to the issue layout and you will see the field is not there.

Do not rely on the new issue view because that view is hardcoding the Story points field. 

h3. Expected Results 
The expected result would be for that field to be present so users can start using it.

h3. Workaround
Add the field to all the screens
fields.summary: Creating an Agile Classic project in Jira does not add the Story points field in the screens

fields.description: Hi I am an administrator user for JIRA SW, I couldn´t to create an epic, when I have tried to create an epic the epic box is empty
fields.summary: Epic Box is Empty

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

"+Create" button is missing from Kanban board, but it is shown in screenshot when creating new Kanban project.
h3. Environment

JIra Software cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a classic project
 # Click on "Change template":
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 # Click on "What's in this?" under Kanban template:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
 # Screenshot of Kanban board shows "+Create" button:
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 
 # Click on "Select" to create a new Kanban project

h3. Expected Results

Kanban board has "+Create" button as shown in screenshot.

h3. Actual Results

Kanban board does not have "+Create" button:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "+Create" button is missing from Kanban board

fields.description:
Currently JIRA has only 3 roles in next gen version (Admin, Member, Viewer).

I want to restrict certain users from creating / editing and deleting issues .

For this if i set Role to Viewer , I am not able to assign issues to him .

To resolve this i need to create my custom role and assign permissions to the role.

However there is no provision to create custom roles.
fields.summary: Provision to create Custom roles

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

As a user, I want the selected assignee on the Backlog to be kept during a page refresh or when opening the URL in a different tab like it happens in the Kanban Board/Active Sprint.
h3. Actual Results

The assignee information won't be kept if you refresh the backlog page, being necessary to reselect the assignee.
h3. Expected Results

Keep the assignee information when refreshing the backlog page.
fields.summary: As a user, I want the selected assignee on the Backlog to be kept during a page refresh

fields.description:
Comments from a user, "It would be nice if there could be a resize of "status columns" without resizing the cards. The result is that depending the width, there are one or multiple cards aside eachother like this screen shot. Containg column "start development, "development", "development done". We have a status column, containing 2 columns with cards that have the same state. This is pretty handy when you overview the whole team, multiple developers."

!image-2019-05-07-00-17-38-318.png!
fields.summary: Ability to resize columns in board so that each column can display multiple cards in a row

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing an issue in the board's detail view, and its sub-tasks have an assignee, that assignee's avatar will cover the screen (its size is too big):
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-06 at 10.12.57.png|thumbnail!   !Screen Shot 2019-05-06 at 10.22.28.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a Software board;
 # Open the detail view of an issue;
 # If its sub-tasks do not have an assignee, add one.

h3. Expected Results

The assignee's avatar should not be so big that it covers a lot of the information.

h3. Actual Results

The avatar's size is too big.

h3. Workaround

Hover over the sub-tasks so the ellipses button will be displayed if you need to perform an action:
 !ellipses button.png|thumbnail! 
Use the new issue view, where that behaviour does not occur:
 !new view.png|thumbnail! 
* Personal settings -> Activate the Jira Labs feature.
fields.summary: User's new default avatar's size is too big in the sub-tasks when viewing the board detail view

fields.description:
I have a longish ticket that I cannot save and I get the growl that my ticket contains unrecognized formatting - this growl is not valid, since the problem was that the ticket was too long. 

 

Could you please change the growl so that it helps me resolve the problem and not get stuck copying and pasting text from Notepad to Jira to get rid of the formatting you tell me is wrong.
fields.summary: Correct growls for user creating a ticket

fields.description:
When viewing the pull requests for a given issue, we would like to see them separated by the repository. ([screenshot|https://d.pr/i/69JdjZ])

Similar to JSWCLOUD-17395
fields.summary: Display pull requests separated by its repository

fields.description:
Right now, the timeline data range limit is -1y past +2y future from today.

This limit is set via application source code and cannot be modified.

According to the development team responsible for this feature, a data range limit higher than that can cause performance issues on Roadmap.

Please implement the option where users can customize the timeline data range limit.roa
fields.summary: Roadmaps - Customisable timeline date range limit.

fields.description:
If you create a new custom field in a next-gen project, there is the option to add a field description.

 !Screen Shot 2019-05-01 at 22.42.01.png|thumbnail! 

However, the new Jira issue view does not show the custom fields descriptions.

There is no point in having the option to add a field description if you can't see the field description with the new Jira issue view.

Please implement the custom fields descriptions on next-gen projects (new Jira issue view).
fields.summary: Next-gen projects - Fields description not available on new Jira issue view.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In a next-gen project, you can't drag an issue into a sprint (click and drag, using the field in the issue or via the meatball menu) if it has been cloned from an issue that has subtasks.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a story in next-gen with a couple of subtasks.
 # Clone the story

h3. Problem

It is impossible to move the newly cloned issue into a sprint. (No matter the combination of checkbox options that you choose - Clone subtasks and/or Clone sprint value -)
h3. Notes

There is no errors on the frontend.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: You can't drag a cloned issue into a sprint in next-gen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Release panel does not show in Jira old issue view.
It displays in Jira new issue view and displays deploy information from BitBucket pipelines

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform a deploy in BitBucket
# At the new issue view, there is a Release panel with the deploy information
# Changing to the old view, the panel is not present.

h3. Expected Results
The panel should be displayed in both issue views.

h3. Actual Results
The panel is present only in the new issue view.

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Release panel does not show in Jira old issue view

fields.description:
In the older projects, you could see a ticket priority in the backlog (which was quite helpful for determining what should be included in a given sprint) without having to click into the ticket. Example below

!image-2019-05-01-11-08-13-680.png!

 

However, in the next gen projects, this feature is gone and all that can be viewed is ticket asignee and story points. Would be amazing if you could bring back the feature that allows you to view priority. 

 

Post about it here as well: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Issues-priority-to-be-displayed-in-the-Backlog/qaq-p/960974]
fields.summary: Would like to view priority in Next Gen backlog

fields.description:
I've seen many request for features in next-gen projects to allow one to show issues from different projects in a single board, run parallel sprints in one project, dashboards for task management across projects, sumarize estimations in epics and some others that looks like someone is trying to manage a portfolio or a program using pieces of different features.
 
What about really allow portfolio management on Jira? And not just on next-gen projects, but on classics as well. A pretty good deliverable would be a company roadmap.
fields.summary: Allow portfolio management on Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Sometimes normal users with 'Manage Sprints' permission are not able to manage sprints.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install add-on called 'Jql Search Extensions for Jira' on a Jira Software Cloud site.
# Create a JSW user called "Normal User" without Jira administration permission.
# Create another JSW user called "Admin User" with Jira administration permission.
# Create a filter with below JQL which pulls tickets from multiple JSW projects. Let's name this filter as "First Filter".
{noformat}
project in ("Project A", "Project B", "Project C", "Project D", "Project E", "Project F")
{noformat}
# Now, create another filter with below JQL. In this case, the filter is using another filter in the query. Let's name this as "Scrum Filter".
{noformat}
filter = "First Filter"
{noformat}
# Make sure "Manage Sprints" permission in all the projects are managed through project roles and "Normal User" is added to respective roles which has below permissions.
#* Administer Projects, Browse Projects & Manage sprints
# Using "Admin User", create a scrum board based on the "Scrum Filter".
# Login as the "Normal User" to perform sprint operations on the scrum board.

h3. Actual Results
"Normal User" with 'Manage Sprints' permission on the projects is not able to perform sprint operations. The respective sprint operation buttons are grayed out.

h3. Expected Results
Normal JSW user with 'Manage Sprints' permission on the projects should be able to perform sprint operations.

h3. Workaround
Update the board settings to use the direct filter. i.e., use "First Filter" in the board from this example.
fields.summary: Sometimes normal users with 'Manage Sprints' permission are not able to manage sprints.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Merge commit messages result in duplicate entries in Jira when using Smart Commits (comments, work log, and transition).

h3. Environment

Jira Software Cloud
Bitbucket Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In Bitbucket, create a branch and commit a change with "KEY-123 #comment test comment"
# Create a pull request for the branch and merge it
# The merge commit that Bitbucket creates will contain "KEY-123 #comment test comment" again

h3. Expected Results

Only 1 comment is visible in the issue KEY-123

h3. Actual Results

The comment will "test comment" will appear twice in the issue KEY-123

h3. Workaround

Edit the merge commit and remove the smart commit command "#"
fields.summary: Merge commit messages result in duplicate entries in Jira when using Smart Commits.

fields.description:
A page that shows all epics from all projects on one single roadmap.

Super useful for the CPO/CTO/Director type peeps.
fields.summary: Global roadmap

fields.description: To make "Blocked by", "Related to" and other typical fields.
fields.summary: Issue picker custom field

fields.description: We'd like to upgrade all of our projects from legacy projects to next-gen projects but there is one item giving us pause. Legacy projects have a wide array of reporting capabilities that we rely on. With the new next-gen projects, there are only two available reports, both of which require the use of sprints. We are a Kanban shop so we're not going to be using sprints. This means that if we transitioned to using next-gen projects then we'd have zero visibility into our velocity. Measuring our velocity is important to our team so we won't be able to upgrade until this oversight is addressed.
fields.summary: Expanded Reporting Capabilities for Team-managed Projects

fields.description:
All issues in the backlog have the same status as the first column on the board. This means that when looking at an issue via the issue view (say, via a search) it is impossible to tell if a "to do" issue is in the backlog or on the board. It's also impossible to move it onto the board from the issue view, or vice versa.

This leads to a cumbersome workflow when moving items back and forth between the board and the backlog. You have to find the issue via the board or backlog view and make the change there. 

You should be able to see and change whether an issue is on the board or the backlog when viewing the issue directly.
fields.summary: Next-gen - see and change whether issue is on board or in backlog

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*
Report selection for Jira for Resource Utilisation is absence and Forecast & Management template reports function is limited 

h3. *Suggestion*
Provide Resource Utilisation Report or provide more customisable function to the existing reports.
fields.summary: Provide Resource Utilisation Report

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*

It's not possible to configure what field can be shown on the Sprint at the moment.
 !Screenshot 2019-04-29 at 12.16.36 PM.png|width=628,height=174!
h3. *Suggestion*

Have selectable column to show specific field for improve overview of the backlogs.

ie. Field Selection from Issue Navigator

!Screenshot 2019-04-29 at 12.58.21 PM.png!
fields.summary: Configurable field view on Sprint Backlog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After adding a due date to an Epic, there is no option to clear the value and leave it empty.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Next-Gen project
 # Create an Epic
 # Add a due date
 # There is no option to clear the due date value

h3. Expected Results

The field should behave the delete command from the keyboard
h3. Actual Results

The field doesn't behave.
h3. Workaround

The workaround is to click at the field and full select the value using (CTRL+A or COMMAND+A) and hit delete and enter.
 The field will be erased after hitting enter but there is no animation showing the field being erased.

 

Updated workaround
 * Select date field
 * Backspace
 * Enter

Date stays visible after Backspace but is removed after Enter.
fields.summary: Unable to clear due dates in an easy way for Next-Gen projects

fields.description:
It's great that comments on Jira support inline code blocks to aid communication within product development teams. However, one language is conspicuous by its absence. Please add C# to the list of languages. You could even re-use the same stylesheet you use to format Java code, at least initially.

Expected behaviour: C# in the Select Language dropdown.

Actual behaviour: C# is not in the Select Language dropdown.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Go to any Jira board, e.g one of ours at 
[https://autoprotect.jira.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=19&projectKey=XXXX&view=planning&selectedIssue=XXXX-123456|https://autoprotect.jira.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=19&projectKey=PROD&view=planning&selectedIssue=PROD-12644]

2) Click on an issue/ticket on that board to view the details in the preview pane on the right.

3) Add a comment, and while writing select some text in that comment and click the "+" button to create a code block, and click the "Select Language" drop-down.

_Unrelated additional feedback: in your Create Issue form that I'm using right now to create a feature request for Jira, it's unclear which product is which – because your names for the products don't match the names displayed when using the actual product._

!image-2019-04-26-11-00-29-922.png!
fields.summary: Missing from the code block language drop down: C# a major mainstream programming language

fields.description:
Users should have the ability to insert dividers (horizontal lines) into their Agile Board backlogs under Plan view.

For example:
{noformat}story-1
story-2
------division-1--------
story-3
story-4
------division-2--------
story-5
story-6{noformat}
fields.summary: Users should have the ability to insert dividers (horizontal lines) into their Agile Board backlogs under Plan view.

fields.description:
Ability to keep the Epic Link from between two or more Next-Gen projects.
Moving one issue from one Next-Gen project to a second Next-Gen project will remove the Epic Link.

It would be great if the Link could be kept and stay referecing the Epic from the source Next-Gen project like it is in Classic Projects.
fields.summary: Ability to keep the Epic Link from between two or more Next-Gen projects
